body: I turned on events in the logs and it appears that a group of 22 errors are written when the progress is updated. Half are "DownloadProgress map" and half are "RemoteDownloadProgress map".
While I don't think this is a high priority bug it does appear to be blocking other small files from syncing with so many of the same file shown as syncing ahead of them.
Not really, syncthing syncs a file at a time, so this is purely cosmetic.

I've got the same issue on multiple machines, Windows, Linux ~~and Android~~, since about a week or something like that, but I haven't researched how/when/what happens exactly so I can't add any useful info to this issue yet.

If you have any specific questions let me know and I'll try to help!

EDIT: Haven't actually seen the issue on Android side of things.

I frequently see more than one (different) file sync at the same time. If there is one big file many other files appear to sync while the big file is taking much more time than each of the small files. There appear to be 3 or 4 or more slots available and many files seem to fill the available slots while the one big file is blocking one of the slots. I haven't looked into it in any detail but the number of slots appears to vary. Sorry if I'm using the wrong terminology.

In this case the small files are sitting there waiting for days since the big file is 49 GB and it's going to a slow backup computer (Odroid). Using my terminology, the big file appears to be taking up all of the slots even though it should only be taking up one.

I had compression turned on for all data. When I changed it to meta data only the duplicate file names were gone and the smaller files were done, they jumped ahead as expected.

Now for the weird part. I put all 3 systems back to compressing all data and the problem did not come back. There is a single line in the Out of Sync Items list instead of 4 to 9.
What you are talking about is completely unrelated to the UI bug that is seen here.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812565/52282243-40118500-2960-11e9-9cb2-f86f2e37139d.png)
Additional screenshot to show some more variations of this bug.

I also experience this on Syncthing 1.1.0 and Windows 10 x64:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20105593/53904207-930d5380-4056-11e9-844b-24ead75b4915.png)

Don't know how to reproduce...

issue.title: lib/model: Missing queue.Done and reset between pulls (fixes #5332)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: I am not actually certain it fixes #5332 for lack of reproducer, but it's likely the cause: When a file cannot be pulled, it isn't removed from the queue and readded on the next try. And the queue is never reset, so that stays there "forever" (as long as the folder is constantly running). I fixed that instance and added `jobQueue.Reset` that removes everything from queue that's invoked when the iteration is finished - in case the folder is stopped (or I missed something else). And I noticed a missing `changed++` on rename, which is largely cosmetic (as in can't think of an adverse effect right now).

body: @calmh, is it really fixed? Can't check now, but there is an uncertainty in #5626 description.
@SerVB Just reopen if you encounter it with v1.1.2.
